intro: Onosma helvetica subsp. vaudensis, commonly known as the Swiss helmet flower, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Switzerland. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its distinctive helmet-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes. It has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces blue to violet flowers in late summer. This subspecies is noted for its ornamental value and is often found in alpine meadows.
